title: 3 dead, 1 critically injured in Marion County shooting, suspect arrested
content:
Correction appended
Three people are dead and another is in critical condition after a shooting Monday morning at a Marion County blueberry farm, deputies said.
Officers found two men dead when they arrived at the scene around 11:20 a.m., said Lt. Chris Baldridge, a Marion County Sheriff's Office spokesman. A woman was taken to Legacy Emanuel Medical Center and died of her injuries. A man is in critical condition at OHSU Hospital.
Oregon State Police arrested Bonifacio Oseguera-Gonzalez, the suspected shooter, without incident on Interstate 84 east of Portland around 1:25 p.m., Baldridge said. Deputies broadcast a description of Oseguera-Gonzalez and his car to area police agencies, Baldridge said in a news release.
Oseguera-Gonzalez, 29, is facing three aggravated murder charges and a single attempted aggravated murder charge, according to Marion County Jail records.
Baldridge said investigators hadn't identified a motive in the shooting, as of Monday afternoon.
The farm is less than four miles east of Woodburn on Oregon 211 and about four miles northwest of the Wooden Shoe Tulip Farm from South Meridian Road.
Deputies aren't releasing the victims' names. Oseguera-Gonzalez is scheduled to be arraigned Tuesday afternoon, Baldridge said.
-- Samantha Matsumoto
Jim Ryan of The Oregonian/OregonLive staff contributed reporting
A previous version of this report stated a legal marijuana grow operation is located at the Marion County blueberry farm where three people were killed and one person was critically injured Monday, due to incorrect information from a source. Deputies said Tuesday the marijuana grow operation is on a different private property.
